data.title: Pressing Ctrl+Shift+B when a task is already running should show terminate task button. This is a regression
data.body:
- VSCode Version: [Window Title]
  Version 1.5.2
  Commit 66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b
  Date 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Task with Ctrl+Shift+B.
2. Press Ctrl+Shift+B. The notification bar shows info, no way to terminate task.

Before it had a "Terminate" Button allowing to stop the task. Now stopping is undiscoverable.

Before Ctrl+Shift+B could be used as start, stop and restart. It was a very useful shortcut.

data.title: Folder Icons are displayed double
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

After updating to VSCode 1.5.2 (I think I had 1.4 or earlier before that) I noticed that icons with the extension vscode-icons look weird (see 1st screenshot)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/713456/18730514/089cd250-8057-11e6-8df4-cf02eb1eeeb4.png)

When changing to a different icon theme things don't get much better. Here is minimal:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/713456/18730598/7b63c73a-8057-11e6-870b-a0567bc71697.png)

And here is Seti:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/713456/18730617/978bbd46-8057-11e6-81f1-527911194d89.png)

Granted, Seti looks ok, but it's still not great, since the hierarchy is all wrong. for instance, the folder `.meteor/local` isn't expanded. The files
- `.finished-upgraders`
- `.gitignore`
- `.id`
- `packages`
- `platforms`
- `release`
- `versions`

are all in the folder `.meteor` and **not** in the folder `.meteor/local` 

Any ideas how to get rid off the first folder icon and get the hierarchy right? It looked pretty ok, just before I restarted in order to get the update. Thx

data.title: <Question> Reuse YAML built-in grammar in another language
data.body:
Application of YAML syntax to define some properties is very wide.
We are trying to write a vscode extension for Spring Boot application properties. Therefore, we 'd like to keep the same syntax highlighting but provide our own validation/reconciling, content assist, hovers etc.
1. If I define a new language `yaml-application-properties` than we lose syntax highlighting. Tried to hack `extension.pacjageJSON.contributes.garmmars` object in the extension `activate()` function with a relative path to built in YAML grammar file, but it didn't work - looks like grammar is registered before the activation (?) Is there anyway i can re-use built-in YAML grammar without copying `YAML.json` grammar file in my code base and pointing to it in the `package.json`
2. If I re-use the `yaml` language then i get the syntax highlighting but have to define hover, content assist etc. with `registerHoverProvider(...)` etc. and loose validation/reconciling. Also not sure how to proceed with Java based language server in this case... I'd rather not go with this option...

data.title: Global find/replace freezes visual studio code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (1607) 8GB ram

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open PHP source code folder in Visual Studio Code
2. Roughly 250 code files 
3. NOTE: Going through process of upgrading to mysqli, so created equivalent functions that use mysqli instead of mysql
4. Set Search = mysql_num_rows(
5. Set Replace = num_rows(
6. Click the replace all button
7. Dialog: Replace 162 occurences across 89 files with 'num_rows'?
8. Clicked Replace button
9. Visual Studio Code Freezes
10. Dialog: The window is longer responding. You can reopen or close the window or keep waiting. [Reopen] [Keep Waiting] [Close]
11. The only button that seems to work is clicking [Close]

NOTE: I tried other searches with fewer than 50 files and it worked fine. All the files get opened in Visual Studio Code and I can click save all, then close all the windows.

data.title: link in JSONSchema tool-tip over-escaped
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.6.0 (1.6.0) (`master` 641121489ac45fb6588abc6ff6209e4943e9ff2e )
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

[`test-schema.json`](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Sequoia/e59bed17d5706e9f6fe07dc014b53e8a/raw/test-schema.json):

``` json
{
  "title": "JSON schema for testing VSCode",
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "foo": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "If you don't like my schema let me know: http://sequoia.makes.software/contact"
    }
  }
}
```
1. Create the following JSON file in VSCode (referencing 
   
   ```
   {
       "$schema" : "https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Sequoia/e59bed17d5706e9f6fe07dc014b53e8a/raw/test-schema.json",
       "foo": "bar"
   }
   ```
2. Mouseover "foo"
3. Observe that link is improperly escaped
   1. Observe that clicking link does not work

![screenshot 2016-09-21 15 57 33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/317498/18728094/a729556c-8019-11e6-8a3d-a6c841a876bb.png)

data.title: The name "Code" for the editor makes it extremely hard to find information about the editor in search engines
data.body: Please consider renaming the editor to something unique.  It's very tricky to search for issues or help or information online because searching for "code" isn't exactly limiting the results and they are mixed up with Visual Studio results often.

data.title: Intermittently swapping contents of open file with another open file on save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:09:51.625Z)
- OS Version: Linux ia32 3.16.0-4-586

Steps to Reproduce:

This might be hard to reproduce but it's happening at least twice a day for me so I'm reporting it anyway.

*\* May be related to extension: vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter **
1. open a few files, make changes in several, save all, sometimes it will format but then show as dirty, save again and intermittently it will have replaced the contents of one of the open dirty files with the contents of another.  I have seen this issue editing javascript files,
2. Can't make it do it every time unfortunately.  I suspect it's related to the auto formatting of the code before saving , I've figured out how to turn off the format on save for the vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter extension and if this doesn't happen again I'll remove this case and take it up with them.

data.title: Fix colorization for markdown indented paragraphs
data.body:
Issue #8264

**Bug**
Indented paragraphs are not highlighted in markdown files. Up to three spaces are allowed before the first non space character (4 or more spaces turn it into a code block).

**Fix**
Add rule to consume optional spaces before paragrpah start.

closes #8264

data.title: Better bracket highlight visibility
data.body:
From [UserVoice](https://visualstudio.uservoice.com/forums/293070-visual-studio-code/suggestions/10584708-bracket-highlighting) (600 votes)

The bracket highlight is too dim to easily see with most themes. In Notepad++ the brackets change color and become bold, i think that is much easier to see. Highlighting the "current bracket set" would also be really nice.

I understand the themes can be changed in a convoluted way. For such an important feature i think the feature should be default or easily accessible.

data.title: Preserve files on exit (aka hot exit)
data.body:
Opening this now to more easily track changes during development.

Fixes #101

**TODO**
- [x] Backup files that are modified
- [x] Add a delay to file backup to reduce amount of disk access
- [x] Discard backups when files are no longer dirty
- [x] Ensure no collisions occur with backup files
  - [x] Untitled files
  - [x] Text files
- [x] Discard backups when a window is being closed and there is another window open
- [x] Retain backups when the last window is being exited
  - [x] Ensure backups are up to date
- [x] Restore backups if available on first window launch
  - [x] Restore text files
  - [x] Restore untitled files
  - [x] Launch a second window if the backup folder is different to that requested

**Feedback Round 1**
- [x] [Clarify "workspace" name in IBackupService](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4091575) (fixed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400/commits/1a29d14961c32633dd2bd3043c9614344279a469)
- [x] [Share `BackupService` between the main and renderer processes](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4093389) (fixed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400/commits/c280e0cac0c81de10802af3df4a8cc50b1e1b9ca)
- [x] [Move `BackupService` to `vs/platform/backup/node/`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4093819) (fixed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400/commits/3387b6c1b1cf0378724497c807de4ba2bdc319df)
- [x] [Opening empty workspaces currently errors out, disable completely for empty workspaces](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4094188) (fixed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400/commits/10aa7095f6fa6104155bf97adfd8e4ad6dc5eb28)
- [x] [Avoid sync calls where possible](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4094309) (fixed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400/commits/2b0a65afb0a7b9856881f59bb419ac05e4cab2a5)

**Clean up**
- [x] Resolve remaining TODOs
- [x] Remove any `console.log` statements
- [x] Add some tests
- [x] Remove all empty lines at beginning of functions https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12400#pullrequestreview-4095956
- [x] Have backup service tests use a temporary folder for backups (needed to have tests pass on Travis)

**Known issues/follow ups**
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13305 Support multiple folder restore
  - Behavior on Mac is a little strange right now due to the fact that the application is kept open when all windows are closed. This will not feel natural on Mac until restoring multiple workspaces is resolved (made notes there)
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13733 Support hot exit on empty workspaces
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12327 Hot Exit: Restore files after an editor crashes
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14038 The tab dirty indicator is up to date right after restore, the file needs to be opened before it refreshes. See call to `this.setDirty(true);` in `TextFileEditorModel.load`
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14037 Merge backup path logic from `node/fileService.ts` into `backupService.ts`

data.title: VSCode overriding files original encoding settings
data.body:
**From Brick George:**
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Windows 10

I ran into a bug with some HTML/CSS files I had created in Visual Studio and then opened up to edit in Visual Studio Code. My Jekyll server threw this error:

```
[2016-09-21 09:49:59] ERROR Errno::ECONNRESET: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host. @ io_fillbuf - fd:6
        C:/Ruby22/lib/ruby/2.2.0/webrick/httpserver.rb:80:in `eof?'
        C:/Ruby22/lib/ruby/2.2.0/webrick/httpserver.rb:80:in `run'
        C:/Ruby22/lib/ruby/2.2.0/webrick/server.rb:294:in `block in start_thread'
```

After some digging around, I discovered that VSCode was overriding my files original encoding settings (**Unicode UTF-8 without signature**), and changing it to **Unicode UTF-8** with signature. That hidden character does some goofy things with Jekyll/Ruby on Windows. Sometimes it can stop an entire site from building correctly. I had to open the files back up in vanilla VS and use the Advanced Save Options to re-encode the file. That fixed the error message.

I doubt very many people are using the combination of VSCode and VS like I was, but it seems like preserving a users file settings should be a fairly important consideration for teams that have members on different operating systems. Barring that, VSCode needs a way to manually change the file encoding settings, similar to Advanced Save Options in VS. (That menu option might already exist, but I didnt find it  clicking the UTF-8 at the bottom of the screen pops the option to Reopen with encoding or Save with encoding, but doesnt give me an obvious way to change the encoding.)

Thanks! :)

data.title: SQL Language mode incorrectly interprets a hashtag as the beginning of a comment.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a hashtag on a line.
2. Observe that everthing beyond the hashtag is colorized as a comment.

Example code:

```

--This is a comment in SQL.
/*
This, too, is a SQL comment.
*/
CREATE TABLE #temptable(sometextfield nvarchar(20))
INSERT INTO #temptable(sometextfield)VALUES('This is incorrectly colorized')
SELECT * FROM #temptable
```

![hashtag_comment_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/898803/18720915/2d5327d2-7feb-11e6-8784-74f9ce60a425.jpg)

data.title: Cannot type `#` with Neo keyboard layout
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **1.5.2**
- OS Version: **OSX 10.11.6**
### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install and activate [Neo](http://neo-layout.org)
2. Try to type a `#` in any file (option+ with Neo)
### Expected Result

The character `#` gets inserted at the cursor position.
### Actual Result

No character gets inserted at the cursor position.

data.title: showInputBox: Default value not returned on ENTER
Multi cursor deletion not working correctly with cursors on the same line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set multiple cursors in the same line of text
2. Press delete/backspace

For instance, in the line:

`test test`

Setting two cursors, one at the start of each word, and then pressing the delete key will result in:

`est tst`

data.title: Not reporting tsc compile errors correctly in the problems view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider (commit: 90dda7af)
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a project with Angular CLI
2. Observe, that the tsconfig.json is _not_ in the root directory of the project, but under src/
3. Add a _readonly_ class member field "readonly readOnlyProperty" to a class
4. Add a method to this class which assigns to `this.readOnlyProperty`
5. Observe that the editor does not flag this as an error
6. Add a typescript compilation task in Visual Studio Code with `"args": ["-p", "src"]`
7. Execute that task
8. Observe that there is no error output
9. Execute `tsc -p src` from the command line (using the same tsc version)
10. Observe that the "assignment to readonly field" error is shown

Also, it looks like other errors, such as real syntax errors, are only reported as warnings in the Visual Studio Code editor "problems" view, whereas the tsc command line compiler flags them as real errors.

It might have something to do with the tsconfig.json file _not_ residing under the root of the project, but inside the "src/" directory, as seems to be best-practice with Angular 2 projects. At least this is how Angular CLI creates the project.

data.title: Ruby Syntax Highlighting Crashes VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, Version: 1607, OS Build: 14393.0

I first noticed this when working with a `Vagrantfile` which is a Ruby-based DSL, but it appears it any Ruby file will bring my editor to a halt.  `Vagrantfile`s were just nicer because they don't have the `.rb` extension and therefore don't crash until I enable the Ruby syntax highlighting.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Vagrantfile
2. `CTRL` + `K`, `M`
3. Select Ruby from languages
4. Wait for VSCode to freeze

The file doesn't crash if I don't enable Ruby syntax highlighting.  I don't see any errors output to the Dev Console.  I don't (_think_) I have any plugins installed that target Ruby.

data.title: Option to highlight matching () [] {} <> within quoted strings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I write a lot of code that contains LDAP query strings, meaning lots of expressions inside `( )` inside quoted strings. It would be nice to be able to have highlighting of matching `( )` (and also, to be able to jump to matching pairs) within quoted strings.
